questions.question: What is the general formula for the iso-structural complexes synthesized with Cd(II) and Zn(II) as reported?
Which gases were used to demonstrate the breathing transitions of the layered coordination polymers?
questions.answer: N2 and H2 gases

questions.question: What was the observed effect of incorporating mixed metal ions into the coordination polymers on their gas sorption capacities?
questions.answer: The incorporation of mixed metal ions into the coordination polymers resulted in better gas sorption capacities compared to the parent coordination polymers.

questions.question: True or False: The solid solutions containing Zn(II)/Cd(II) showed decreased uptake capacities for gases compared to the parent coordination polymers.
questions.answer: False

questions.question: What was the role of the solid solution approach in the study of layered coordination polymers?
questions.answer: The solid solution approach was used to modulate the breathing behavior of layered coordination polymers by influencing their gate opening pressure (Pgo) and gas sorption capacities through the incorporation of mixed metal ions.

questions.question: How did the gate opening pressure (Pgo) values of the solid solutions compare to those of the parent complexes?
questions.answer: The solid solutions exhibited intermediate Pgo values compared to those of the parent complexes, dependent on the ratio of Zn and Cd.

questions.question: True or False: The gas sorption studies indicated that the materials did not exhibit any stepwise gas sorption with hysteresis.
questions.answer: False

questions.question: What was the significance of the observed hysteresis in the gas sorption behavior of the coordination polymers?
questions.answer: The observed hysteresis in the gas sorption behavior indicated the dynamic nature of the coordination polymers, showcasing their ability to reversibly transition between open and closed forms, which is crucial for applications in gas storage and separation.

questions.question: True or False: The synthesis of binary solid solutions was achieved through a direct one-step synthesis method.
questions.answer: True

questions.question: What was the effect of the anions present in the coordination polymers on their gas sorption properties?
questions.answer: The study demonstrated that both the cations and anions present in the coordination polymers significantly influence their gas sorption properties, with the solid solution approach offering a method to modulate these properties.

questions.question: True or False: The physical mixture of complexes 1 and 3 showed a double breathing sorption, indicating that solid solutions 5 and 6 are merely physical mixtures of two parent complexes.
questions.answer: False

questions.question: What was the observed behavior of H2 gas sorption in the complexes?
questions.answer: Only complex 1 was found to adsorb H2, exhibiting stepped sorption similar to that of N2, which highlights the selective sorption behavior of these coordination polymers.

questions.question: True or False: The water vapor sorption studies indicated that the materials are hydrophilic in nature.
questions.answer: False

questions.question: How did the sorption capacities of the solid solutions compare to those of the parent complexes?
questions.answer: The solid solutions exhibited improved sorption capacities compared to their single component crystals, indicating that the integration of different metal ions can enhance the overall sorption capacity of the material.

questions.question: True or False: The structural transformations involved in the network during gas sorption were significant and easily detectable for all complexes.
questions.answer: False

questions.question: What was the proposed mechanism for the gate opening and closing phenomenon observed in the coordination polymers?
questions.answer: The gate opening and closing phenomenon was proposed to occur by the rotation of one of the uncoordinated but hydrogen bonded –OCO–Py group through a C–O single bond, facilitated by the flexible nature of the hydrogen bond and the out-of-plane placement of the –OCO–Py groups.

questions.question: True or False: The study demonstrated that the gas sorption properties of iso-structural coordination polymers are independent of the metal ions and anions present in the network.
questions.answer: False

questions.question: What challenges are associated with the functionalization of organic linkers in the design of dynamic porous coordination polymers?
questions.answer: The functionalization of organic linkers is critical as the networks are very sensitive towards reaction conditions, often leading to unpredictable results, which poses a challenge in achieving desired properties in dynamic porous coordination polymers.

questions.question: True or False: The study found that the solid solution approach is less advantageous than transmetallation for preparing binary solid solutions.
questions.answer: False

questions.question: What role do host–guest and host–host interactions play in the dynamic behavior of porous coordination polymers?
questions.answer: Host–guest and host–host interactions play a significant role in triggering the dynamic behavior of porous coordination polymers, allowing them to modulate their pore size and nature, and reversibly oscillate between closed and open forms.
